Reviews.Title: “A Fine Resort in a Colorful, Happy Town”
Reviews.Author: School's Out 3
Reviews.Content: The Galleon Resort and Marina is a timeshare property, affiliated with RCI with a Gold Crown rating. Rentals are also available. We stayed in a two bedroom unit with friends that we enjoy traveling with. The unit was very roomy with full kitchen, eating area and full living room, along with a nice balcony overlooking the pool and water. The master bedroom is very large and comfortable, while the second bedroom is much smaller and quite basic. All in all, the unit is extremely comfortable with a number of amenities including a washer and dryer. The several story building has elevators with parking available underneath on ground level. The property is in good repair. This resort is a rather laid back, low key, relaxing property. It has a pool, hot tub, Tiki bar/simple meals, with live entertainment (vocalist) in the evenings. The pool is very attractive, though it can get crowded. The property also has a very small beach on site, large enough for a few lounge chairs, but a beach none the less. The property offers two welcome barbecues a week with low cost burgers/chicken/hot dogs and raffles of services/discounts in the area. Attending is a good way to mix with fellow guests and share notes about restaurants, activities, etc. I found the staff at the reception desk to be extremely pleasant and a wealth of good suggestions regarding restaurants and activities. Elaine, the activities person and pool attendant is a real sweetheart. She gave us great suggestions regarding restaurants to try. The absolute best feature of this property is location, location, location! One could not ask for more. It is located right on the marina with beautiful views from the sun bathing decks. One can watch the boat activity, fishing activity, water sports, bird life, etc. Very pleasing! From this property, one can walk everywhere. Located on the marina, it is adjacent to where the Harbor Walk begins with a multitude of restaurants, bars, entertainment, water sports, boat excursions, and shopping. It is also wonderful to walk this area in the morning for beautiful photography opportunities and to see all the activity begin. Key West is a walking town. Get a perspective and a bit of knowledge by taking the Conch Train Tour upon arrival. It is well narrated and it will set you in the right direction for all of your walking excursions. Mallory Square, the gathering place from which to view sunsets and see street performers do their thing, is just a few blocks from the Galleon. The start of Duvall Street, known for shopping, restaurants, bars, and entertainment begins just one block from the Galleon. Many tourist attractions are just a few blocks away as well. When walking on the side streets, roosters, chickens, and cats are abundant. They add to the color and flair of Key West. The tropical gardens of the individual homes that one passes by are a lovely site. Key West is filled with a great variety of restaurants in all price ranges. One just needs to walk and look at menus as one passes by. You can even get glimpses of diners and of food being served at the various outdoor sitting areas. The thought, “That looks good” might lead you in to sit down and place your order. Restaurants where we had a great meal: Abbondanza Italian Restaurant, Blue Heaven, Mangia, Mangia, Duffy’s Steak and Lobster House, and Fogarty’s. There are several beaches in Key West, all man made. Port Zachary Taylor State Park has a nice beach where one can spend the day. Lounge chairs are available for rent. It is within walking distance from the Galleon - a longer walk, or a short cab drive. Higg’s Beach, Rest Beach, and Smather’s Beach are closer to the airport and a cab ride from the resort. An enjoyable/educational activity to participate in while in Key West is kayaking through the mangrove creeks. We did the two hour guided tour for $35 through Lazy Dog Kayak Guides located at the Hurricane Hole marina. This is a very professional operation. When arriving in Key West, one can fly into the Key West Airport or fly into Miami and rent a car in order to drive the Keys. Each has its appeal. Allow 4 hours for the drive from Miami to Key West. We have done both for variety. Driving offers a good perspective on how the Keys are situated. We had a good week in Key West at the Galleon. The Galleon is a fine resort in a happy, colorful town.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Timeshare at Galleon Resort”
Reviews.Author: krempert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great week at the Galleon resort in Key West last weekend. We used an RCI exchange into this property 2 weeks before our arrival date with our Red week in French Lick, Indiana. Call us lucky! When we arrived, there were construction/remodling in the front office which was dirty and noisy for our arrival. However, it was good to see the updating for a relatively older property. Our 2 bd, 2 bath unit 24 was located on the second floor looking over the marina. The unit and furniture was in good shape, except for the tiles in our master bathroom. The only problems that we encountered on our visit was with the Timeshare coordinators (Deanna) husband, Cliff, who called us 20 min before our scheduled 60-min Timeshare visit to tell us that they had to cancel. We highly recommend the following restaurants, bars and activities when in Key West. A&B's- fantastic dinner overlooking marina (pricey) Alonza's-Happy hour 1/2 price drinks ($2 beer) and appetizers (1 pound shrimp $12!) B.O.'s Fish- great value grouper and red snapper Blue Heaven- great food and outdoor seating (see pics) Green Parrot- legendary bar (go on Sunday afternoon for local Jam session) Sloppy Joe's- fun Duval bar with Ernest Hemingway history (great during lookalike contest) Antonia's- excellent Italian restaurant on Duval street Mallory square- don't miss sunset event Ft Zackary Beach and Hicks beach

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CedarRidgeTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks during January. We had to change rooms after a week but it actually worked out great. We stayed in rooms F43 and E 42. Both of these rooms have a great view, overlooking the Marina. The balcony was definitely a favorite spot to kick back, have a cocktail and enjoy the scenery. As there was 6 of us, it worked out well with the two bedrooms, and a pullout sofa we were not crowded and we utilized the kitchen to make the stay even more economical. This location is perfect....on the marina, easy walking to all the Duval attractions yet quiet to sleep. We loved the walk along the quay with the different bars and restuarant so close. The pool and gazebo-bar were perfect for drinks and sun. The down side....the decor of the rooms were ok, perhaps not great but the location made up for it. The bathroom looked like they were freshly renovated. We will definitely rent here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly renovated but great location”
Reviews.Author: Nomonkeybutt
Reviews.Content: You pay for location but there are really no amenaties. We would have expected more resources available within the room (ie coffee for coffee pot). We woul have expected more service from front desk staff, no concierge no pool staff poor food and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Galleon Resort - Don't Go There”
Reviews.Author: Sunmom46
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Galleon for one night in a B Unit, their smallest unit. The room was small, dark and smelled musty. The kitchenette is literally the hallway outside of the bathroom. Ugh! The bathroom door on the inside looked as if there had been a leak from the toilet as the wood was coming off the bottom. Ironically, the closet was large. Our room had only one window, no balcony or other source of light. Unfortunately we had to keep the blinds closed as the view we had was the garbage. That's right, in the E building where we were, literally right outside your door are the recycling bins for paper, plastic and bottles. And right outside your window is a large garbage bin. Anytime someone tosses in their garbage or bottles, you can hear it - at 3:00 a.m. Check out is at 10:00 a.m., we left at 8:00 a.m. Couldn't wait to get out of there. Manager was useless. When we complained about the room, the only thing he could do for us was to offer us a more expensive room. Believe me, this room was $275 +, double the price of the fantastic hotel Pegasus International on Duval. Yup, that's what you get at the Galleon for $275 - tiny, dark room with no view in a timeshare that is not kept up. I will never go there again. I keep wondering if all these great reviews are from people who own timeshares!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great View”
Reviews.Author: STraveler2
Reviews.Content: This 'condo' style resort is a short couple of blocks from the action of Duval Street yet located on the water overlooking the Gulf of Mexico and Key West's largest Marina. Our two bedroom 'condo' had a full kitchen and wonderfully comfortable master bedroom suite. The second bedroom was a little like a cave, but still comfortable. With all of the marina activity passing your balcony, there is little need for the TV's in every room. The deck and tiki hut are convenient and some rooms even have sunset views. Walk to many restaurants and/or bars. We would definitely come back to this place again and again. The beach is tiny but the pool makes up for it. The comfort, convenience and view are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “A Positive Galleon Experience”
Reviews.Author: G D
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West, trading within RCI for the week at the Galleon. We do have to agree with the other reviews that are here that the location is the best part of the resort. A short walk to the north end of Duval, around the marina to the multiple day cruises, or to the best part Mallory Square for the sunset. The checkin process was easy with the very helpful front desk staff. The female employee that checked us in gave us a map of the area and pointed out some recommendations for places to eat. Parking is a bit tight if you have a larger car, but it is an island where there is not a lot of space to park in general. The options for places to catch some sun were nice. It was nice to have the deck area off the tiki bar if you didn't want to sit by the pool where there were more kids and families playing or the midweek games of bingo were taking place. The Tiki bar is a good stop to grab a quick drink and on site food options were adequate. The unit was clean on checkin, the furniture a bit dated, but the bathroom update was a nice treat. We had a unit with a marina view (E building) and noise from the marina was never a problem. There were many nights after we had worn out our legs walking Duval that we rested on the deck and could enjoy the music from the local places on the marina that never went too late. If you didn't want to venture to Mallory Square with the crowds for the sunset, the observation deck was a nice option. The other residents up there were even nice enough to exchange picture taking responsibilites to get a couple's picture. There were many options of activities leaving from the marina in the area of the Galleon. Rent a waverunner, go parasailing, charter a fishing boat, day cruises, sunset cruises, etc all you had to do is take a short walk to find it. A nice option for the sight-seeing is the city trolley tours that left from just in front of the custom's house. They take you by all the major spots and you can jump on and off all day. The Galleon definitely qualifies as a resort destination that we'd be happy to return to on future vacations.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: honkytonkdog1
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to key west for years and always gravitate toward this part of town so I figured it was time to try the galleon. The location is fantastic and the views are amazing. The observation deck is one of the best views in key west. We had a marina view two bedroom which enjoyed a great view of the yachts. This side of the resort also has quite a bit of noise from the tiki bar below and from the surrounding units. The beds were very uncomfortable, the furniture dated and worn and a strong odor of urine on check in. The pool and spa were great but it was pretty much a day care center from 9-5. There was a sign with an age limit for the spa but it was invariably filled with the swim diaper set. The deck overlooking the water was a top feature but the lounge chairs were the worst I have experienced. On the positive there were very good bloody mary's at the tiki. Don't waste your time with ordering food (frozen french fries and white bread) at the galleon. Go to white tarpon for takeout. After all that i would still probably return. Location, location, location!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Best Location and Great Views w/ Large 2BR Suite”
Reviews.Author: RanRan70
Reviews.Content: I was able to trade into The Galleon Resort through RCI and I am very glad that I did. The location of the resort is amazing. Right on the marina, two blocks from Duval. You could not ask for a more perfect location in Key West, especially if you are planning to walk like I did. The resort even offered Saturday pick up and/or drop off from the airport for free. The pool and hot tub are nice. It has a sauna and gym, which I did not use. The front desk staff were amazing but housekeeping did an okay job. They switch the linens mid-week but did not sweep or mop the floors. I prefer daily housekeeping, but the resort charges an extra $20 per day for that. The Tiki Bar was nice, 2 for 1 bloody mary's in the morning, $6.00 burger and hot dog on Monday and Wednesday and other lunch specials. The master bathroom had been remodeled and it is amazing but the rest of the unit is a bit dated and even though it is clean, it surely could be updated. The bedding was not luscious.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to offer in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ebra17
Reviews.Content: Our day trip to Key West turned into an overnight and the Galleon happily accommodated us in a clean, comfortable room for the night. It was conveniently located next to the docks from where our chartered snorkel trip left the next morning, and walking distance to lots of restaurants. We enjoyed the pool/jacuzzi and used the fitness room. Plus we got to see a gorgeous sunset from their rooftop deck. Service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “All good except reception hit and miss.”
Reviews.Author: Griz4289
Reviews.Content: We just got back, we stayed for race week. The resort is very nice great location near everything. The 10am check out is not great but you know that going in so it's not a surprise. Lots hot water good pressure and very clean. We had a great room with a view over the marina. We had to ask a few questions at the front desk and I think because it's all time shares they don't have to be nice. We found one of the girls she works the after 3 shift ok but the men are just plan rude. We were nice to them all but no matter house nice you are you do not get it in return.

Reviews.Title: “10am hard checkout”
Reviews.Author: Johnny12356
Reviews.Content: I have never heard of hotel having a hard checkout time of 10am until I stayed here. At 10am were told that if we did not get out immediately we would be charged 100 Dollars an hour. They called incessantly and banged on the door until we left at 10:15am. If you have any designs on going out and having fun don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Stephen A
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Key West for twenty years this year, and the Galleon is the best hotel in the city (and maybe in the world). We just love the place. Here are just some of the reasons: 1. Close to the Duval Street action, but far enough away for quiet and restful days and nights 2. Right on the marina for boat hire and jet skis 3. Great sunset views from the boardwalk and roof terrace 4. Comfortable rooms with recently refurbished bathrooms 5. Fully self-contained resort with pool, beach, sea, spa, activities, and tiki bar Highly recommended resort. Book with confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent view”
Reviews.Author: LaurenAlexHRL
Reviews.Content: We rented through a two bedroom condo - that was harbor view on the 5th floor through VRBO. I had read about the poor customer service prior to arriving on some reviews here at Trip Adviser and had some concerns. We arrived - to a friendly front desk person (forgive me I do not remember his name - but he just moved to Key West from Vale Colorado). He kept our bags so that we could walk around Key West until our room was ready at 4:00pm. The room was very clean, and had two bedrooms - two baths - each bathroom is in located off of each bedroom, a kitchen, and two living areas that had pull out sofa beds. You could easily sleep 4 adults - and 4 children. The balcony had an excellent view of the harbor and the restuarants and boats in and around the harbor. We watched the sunrise every morning! The bar at The Galleon is a great place to meet for drinks before treking off to Mallory Square for the sunset. The small beach at The Galleon is typical of Key West...you don't go to Key West for beaches...the pool was nice - and clean and has another bar- grill right beside for convenience. The Galleon is very convenient to walk to Duval Street, the waterfront wharf and Mallory Square. For a great breakfast - try The Schooner Wharf Bar and listen to some excellent music every morning of the week. Katchia works there and is one of the friendliest servers we met on the entire island! I hope we can return next year and stay in the very same condo!

Reviews.Title: “Great Key West Resort !”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanSole
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, great location & awesome views. Two bedroom unit was HUGE, had everything needed for a great vacation. View of the marina was the best, watching the boats roll in...quiet and peaceful. Then two blocks out the front door was Duval St....music, restaurants & shops galore. Walked to many seafood restaurants along the historic harbor. This resort will NOT let you down ! Scuba diving was great, had romantic sunset dinner at Lattitudes Restaurant on Sunset Key...the Best !

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: M1052
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a two week stay at the Galleon and really couldn't have asked for better! We stayed in a private one bedroom apartment on the top floor of building E which had everything you could want including a private deck area and viewing platform for those world famous Key West sunsets!! The Galleon is ideally situated at the side of the harbour with Duval Street two blocks away, all the main bars and restaurants are within easy walking distance. The Galleon has its own Sunset Tiki Bar which is open from 10am to 10pm serving great food and drinks and not too unreasonably priced for a resort bar. Having read some of the other reviews it is difficult to believe we went to the same place! We found all the staff to be helpful and friendly, we were told when we booked that we wouldn't get house keeping (which suited us), but they tried to get to us three times anyway! Overall this is a great place and we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot, great views, needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Bruce88
Reviews.Content: We took a friend's week timeshare. One bedroom with balcony facing the marina. The space was very well appointed - bedroom, salon, kitchen, and especially the bathroom. Very well done. Interestingly, the lobby was straight out of the 60's/70's. The pool was very clean and had plenty of relaxing deck chairs. Both Tiki bars were very accommodating. Particularly Steve's bar on the Marina side. Great drinks with significant adult beverages.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: dyshgasa
Reviews.Content: The location is the only good thing about this resort. There was little for the kids to do. It was almost impossible to park, the covered lot was too small and the outside spots were always taken. The staff were not helpful. The toilet was broken when we checked in and never fixed. We asked several times for cleaning supplies to do the dishes but they were never provided. The maid never came for a midweek clean. After we checked out they charged my credit card $80 for four hours of extra cleaning. When I asked to see the pictures of the mess I was sent pictures of a room that was not ours, the pictures showed beer cans and bottles and no one in our party drinks beer ( I was traveling alone with 4 young children). The manager was rude when I tried to discuss this with him. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Waterviews, walking distance to Duval St & the Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: babsrose
Reviews.Content: The Galleon is a timeshare resort that also rents condo apartments by the night or week. Recently having undergone a renovation, it offers a variety of conveniences. The rooms are spacious and offer a pool or marina view. They are 2 bedroom/2 bath units. Complete kitchen with washer/dryer, free wifi. You can walk the boardwalk to Key West Historic Seaport or walk in the other direction to Mallory Square. Duval Street is two short blocks away. The Galleon has a large pool, hot tub and beach area along with a sundeck along the waterfront. There is also an exercise room and an Observation Deck on one of the buildings. The Sunset Tiki bar is open all day and the Dockside restaurant is perfect for breakfast or lunch when your lounging around the pool. Room service is also offered. Water sports are available downstairs at the marina. The marina is also an added plus for boaters. Location, Location, the Galleon is the heart of it all! I recommend staying there. You won't be disappointed. They don't miss a beat in providing everything for an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for small kids!”
Reviews.Author: pltn
Reviews.Content: Great location... outdated with very poor, very small parking spots.. however, I have been coming here every year for the last 20 yrs so I know what to expect... but be warned that small kids can EASILY fit through the balcony railings!! My 2 1/2 yr old daughter EASILY fit right through the railings with just a slight turn of her shoulders... her head went through with a couple inches to spare! Within a split second- and I was standing RIGHT there- she slid through the railings hanging on from the OUTSIDE of the balcony and said happily "Look at me!!"... I was in total shock and scared to death! Luckily, she calmly came right back in as easily as she got out. I explained to her that she can never do that again and she could get really bad boo-boo's! When I explained it to the front desk, I was rudely told they hear that alot- the resort is not meant for small kids- and I needed better parental supervision! I was so mad because I was RIGHT THERE! He asked me "What do you want us to do? Plexiglass the whole balcony??" I simply explained, maybe there could at least be a letter in the room stating that kids can fit through the railings, or some sort of warning... I mean, there were even numerous letters in the room stating to not put lobster tails down the garbage disposal, can't they at least put a small warning somewhere for the safety of their guests??? He again told me that parents need to supervise their kids.... Overall rating- good for older kids...

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this value if you are a family of 4 or more...”
Reviews.Author: McTraveler14
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 3 teenage boys (13,15 &19) in a 2 bedroom 2 bath unit in the F bldg. Our unit had balcony that overlooked the marina. This was perfect for us...the kitchen allowed us to have cold drinks, cereal, milk and snacks...the 2 bedrooms and living room allowed us to spread out...and having 2 bathrooms was priceless! The Galleon is not full service and you will pay extra to have your room cleaned while you're there...we let it go for the 4 days we were there. The pool is ok...we spent more time in the salt water by their little beach...and at the pool bar. We had stayed at the Ocean Key previously but this time the kids were bigger and we had added one more...so we would have needed 2 rooms at the Ocean Key (which we love). Our unit at the Galleon was $350/night and you just can't beat that with a pasty of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, Spectacular views of sunset, Great rooms, Walkable to EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: terpMaryland
Reviews.Content: Galleon Resort is awesome. We have enjoyed coming to this resort for the past 12 years. It is a time share that rents its condo rooms. The rooms and the facilities are wonderful and surpass any hotel on the island. You can walk to everything. You can cook in your room, have access to a a great tiki bar and restaurant just downstairs. And Yes- you need to be out of your room promptly at 10am so that they can clean your room for the next guest. This is a VERY POPULAR resort destination.

Reviews.Title: “Worse service I have ever experienced in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: orly15
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?? Well first of all they did not clean our room and said that since we were staying in a "time share" (which was neve explained to us) they do not clean it. Then on the day we were leaving at exactly 10 am they called our room 3 times to kick us out. When we did not respond they showed up in our room and started banging on the door as if we were criminals to kick us out!!! Not to mention during the stay anytime we went to the front desk to ask a question we were answered with smart remarks. Terrible!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No customer service!”
Reviews.Author: angelina0926
Reviews.Content: During the 4th of July weekend my best friend and her boyfriend along with my husband and I decided to take a trip down to Key West, we decided to stay at the Galleon. This was probably one of the worst hotels I have stayed in in a long time. The rooms were nice, spacious and clean. However, the customer service was horrible. The two men working at the front desk were rude and had obviously not been trained properly by the corporation. No one told us that check-out was at 10:00 am and we had no idea considering the fact that check in was at 4:00 pm rather than the usual 3:00 pm of other hotels. At 10:00 am sharp we heard a banging noise on the door and to our amazement it was the man from front desk, yelling that we had to leave since check out was at 10:00 am. We asked if there was a late check out since we were not ready and he yelled "No, you have 5 minutes!" 15 minutes later as we were walking out he came back to tell us that we had to leave. The hotel was $394 a night and this was the method they decided to use for us to check out, completely unacceptable. We will never go back to this hotel and will be sure to tell others not to book here.

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place in key west”
Reviews.Author: lizisinfl
Reviews.Content: room was beautiful, location was perfect, staff was nice and had all the info we needed, pool area and tiki bar were nice, great views from the wrap-around boardwalk would gladly book this resort again and the price was very fair.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat The Galleon!”
Reviews.Author: swordfish-miami
Reviews.Content: The Galleon is the perfect place to stay at in Key West because it stands in the perfect location. Located at the end of Front Street (617) with a marina and spectacular gulf views it is only a couple blocks to the wild scene of Duval Street. My girlfriend and I stayed at The Galleon Resort and Marina with a few friends over Memorial Day weekend. Everything went perfect and to plan from making our reservation with Faith in mid March to the friendly check in. We arrived on the Thursday prior to Memorial Day and immediately began to enjoy our suite and have fun on the rock called Key West. The resort offers several floor plans, has a decent pool with jacuzzi, small private beach, expansive sun deck, a fun Tiki Bar and grill and has a marina with slips if you bring a boat. You can even fish right off the resort desk. We did some 3:30 a.m. fishing and the tarpon were biteing! The private beach area has an enclosed portion of the gulf for resort guests. We snorkeled and were able to get up and close to schools of squid, abundant conch, crabs and a small baracuda that was ziping in and out from under the deck. The enclosed gulf area has a floating dock for sun bathers and the beach area has chairs and chaise lounges. The pool area manager rounds up guests to play in games of bingo. I couldn't believe how serious the pool area gets when bingo is being played. Inside the resort you have a sauna, changing room and shower area. Pool towels can be picked up at the front desk and exchanged at the pool daily. The Galleon Resort has a series of buildings, most of which are connected. We stayed in building C which is far and away the best location as it offers the closest and best gulf and sunset views. Our room was a corner room which was great because the master suite has its own private balcony and a view of the pool. If you can not book or buy into C, then I would suggest buildings B or A which offer pool view as well as gulf view. Building F offers a nice Marina view. I would avoid building G as it only offers street and parking lot views. Take it from us, try The Galleon. It is a top 5 place to stay at in Key West and it has the best location. We extremely pleased with our Key West vacation at The Galleon and plan to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and over priced!”
Reviews.Author: shoebiggsd
Reviews.Content: Staff were arrogant. Room was tiny. Very dissapointing! Will never stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ndmcnu01
Reviews.Content: Overall, it was a positive experience at the Galleon. The positives.. you cannot beat the location. Located right on the water (with a very small private beach), the pool and tiki bar (both nice) overlook the water. The sunsets are beautiful from the pool area. It's about a block away from Duval Street, so walking to most places is very convenient. It's also a short walk away from the wharf that many of the touring companies depart for watersports or sunset cruises. The concierge is helpful in arranging activities, and the staff is friendly and helpful. There is a bike/scooter/electric car rental right at the entrance of the Galleon, which is convenient for areas that you cannot walk. If you plan to book any activities, see the concierge as you many be eligible for a better rate as a guest of the Galleon. The gym is pretty decent and never crowded while we were there. The negatives.... the pool gets very crowded (we went during busy season) and pool chairs are very hard to come by. Most patrons arrive early and reserve a chair with their towel for the entire day (even though signs specifically prohibit this), so get out early if you want a chair. Also, the food service at the tiki bar is questionable. Our appetizer took 30 minutes and was not even warm upon arrival. Free Internet, but the wifi signal is weak. Our laptop had a hard time acquiring a reliable signal. Overall, pleasant experience and a good value compared to other options in Key West. Location, location, location.

Reviews.Title: “Location,location,location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: avm1935
Reviews.Content: Great place, super location, every thing you could need for a great holiday.Since a new general manager ( Wendy) as been appointed the Galleon as seen a big improvement in standards, staff seem more motivated and a happier crew. Super swimming pool and sauna and fitness centre, and its situation right on the boardwalk over looking the marina, easy walks along the boardwalk take you to soom great places to eat. Watch the fishing boats come in and unload their catch, try out a jet ski or go on a sunset cruise all from the Galleon Resort. You are within easy walking distance from Mallory Square and Duval Street. My wife and I enjoyed every minute of our two weeks, we will certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “cockroach,filthy,burns in bedspread,smoking comes into room,managers hide in back room, dont care.”
Reviews.Author: sunshinning
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Galleon Resort and Marina. This is a time share. Hotel is a discrace. It is not a gold crown property! Was to have ocean view, no view. It is located o@ marina in Key West.. Spoke to managers, Bob & Don. Never seen anything like it. I would tell Bob, bed spread burned, carpeting filthy, ripped, ajoning room 2nd hand smoke poured into room, see day light from outside door., hole in closet wall. Bob would go out back tell Don, Don would hide, Bob would hide. Day 3, woke @ 5am saw cockroach on floor. Covered it with glass took photos. Now they sprayed room, washed rug, replaced bed spread with burned one. Filthy rotton disaster! LOCATION was the best, but couldnt see ocean. Private beach was 30' wide sun blocked by hotel next door. Dont do it!

Reviews.Title: “Galleon resort”
Reviews.Author: Kathysue51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Galleon from Dec. 27th through Jan. 1st. We got a two bedroom unit and had 6 guests. The room was very nice. It had a full kitchen , two full bathrooms , living room and two bedrooms with two full balconies. The pool was nice and hot tub nice and warm with a fun Tiki bar ( specials daily.) Other than running out of pool towels on one day I really have no complaints, Yea! It was very relaxing and met our needs completely. Bathrooms were remodeled and nice. We sat on the balcony and watched the pirate drop on New Years Eve. Don't know if I would stay there again just because we like to stay different places each year so if anyone has any suggestions for South Beach please let me know. Overall nice accomodations and fun had by all...

Reviews.Title: “Love the Galleon”
Reviews.Author: danielle376
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for the first time last year, stayed at the Galleon & fell in love with it. Needless to say, we went back this year & stayed there again. You can't beat the location, the staff is great, & the newly remodeled bathroom are beautiful. I have no complaints!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Resort In Key, But Touristy Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsForever1
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom unit for one week at the Galleon. The unit was, in our opinion, more ideally situated than some of the others in that it directly overlook the Marina, and it was fun to sit on the deck and watch the daily comings and goings in the busy Marina. The unit's size was quite large compared to what one normally gets in Key West, with a fully stocked, modern kitchen. The furniture was adequate, not luxurious by any means (a bit dated) and was typical Florida wicker/rattan but was certainly suitable. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was average and could have used a bit of repair. It appeared to have heavy useage. There are both ups and downs to the location. It is right in the "heart of it all". Meaning you can easily walk to most of the tourist destinations, but that also means it is in a fairly crowded and noisey area, which lacks some of the charm that the bed and breakfast type accomodations have in the more resedential sections of Old Town. The main hotel itself is fairly large, comparatively, and a bit more dated looking in general than some of the other larger accomodations in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: manateeHomosassaFL
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Galleon for Fantasy Fest each year. The location is ideal - you can easily walk to every major attraction or rent scooters/electric cars at the resort entrance. You can arrive by the Fast Cat from Ft. Myers Beach and walk or The Galleon provides a shuttle to and from the airport. Being right next door to the old Harbor means excellent dining choices, and all the sunset cruises/sailing adventures just steps away. The resort has a great heated pool & small sandy island beach is available. The rooms are comfortable: king size beds in the master suites and newly remodeled baths with awesome new showers. Watch the sunset from the top of the resort if you don't want the two blocks to Mallory Square. You don't need to worry about a cruise ship blocking your view like some locations or the hassle of parking downtown if you stay across the island. It's all here. The resort keeps improving all the time. This is our 10th year & we wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Hilton instead”
Reviews.Author: Georgiagirl2010_10
Reviews.Content: First, the bed in the master bedroom of the 3 room suite we paid almost $500 a night for contained a bed that creaked every time I took a breath (and I am not large). The only way we could sleep was if we both slept on one side of the bed, which isn't too tough for married couples who like each other but it sure was tough when one had to get up during the night and crawl over the squeaking springs. But then it started drizzling rain, not even a torrential downpour, and the ceiling in one bedroom started leaking....maintenance was "out" until the following day, by which time the ceiling in the bedroom and the bathroom had begun to cave in, and plaster was all over the bed, the stuff in the room, everywhere. We were given a credit of $168 since it was our last night. Not worth it. The Galleon location is perfect, but the Hilton is right next to it - save yourself the stress and just stay at the Hilton. We booked thru a booking agent, Susan Rodnan, who turned out to be the most rude, unprofessional, hateful woman I have had the misfortune to talk to in a long time, when I called her after getting nowhere with the Galleon office management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RPMd10
Reviews.Content: Great location, everything within walking distance. Nice property, Just tough parking. Had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a view”
Reviews.Author: GigisMom819
Reviews.Content: We stay here every year with my parents who have a timeshare. It's a nice place in a great location. The staff is nice and the Tiki bar is great (although they could have more live entertainment). Bingo by the pool is fun and they have a welcome lunch with raffles. The units could use a little modernization and the twin beds are terrible. Rooms on the entrance side can be loud at night when people are coming home from the bar as it echoes. And the parking spots are terrible - WAY too small and sometimes impossible to find a spot. All in all, it's a great location and might be one of the nicest in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort and Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker21_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Galleon wk of 6/26 for 7 days, this was my first time there and I got a 1 bedromm thru my timeshare RCI. This resort is awesome, my suite was almost new and with a great marina view. Their little private beach was awesome along with the Tiki Bar for afternoon drinks. Walked everywhere never had to move my car, which was great. The people at the front desk could be a little nicer/friendly but not bad. My only quarrel: the parking garage is designed for very small cars so if you have a Pickup truck like mine it was not easy to park in the garage. For excursions we used Sebago Charters and took the sunset cruise and the Island Ting excursion, both were great and their staff is super friendly and knowledgable. We picked Sebago over Danger Charters because Sebago is cheaper by $20 p/person and are awesome; both companies offer same excursions. For happy hour I would recommend the resort Tiki Bar which always had specials and Alonzo Oyster Bar which was right beside the resort. Alonzos also had great dinner plates. For dinner: Conch Republic Seafood Restaurant, which was also beside the resort. Hogsbreath bar and Hogfish Bar were also both excellent and not expensive. All in all this was one of the best vacations we've ever had and we have been to the Key West lots of times. Definitely will go back and stay at the Galleon Resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: Smdfamily3
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Keys several times before this visit, and this has been our only disappointment. The hotel staff in a lobby who were flat out rude to guests. One guy at the front desk was snobby towards most everyone, including my daughters which really set me off. The suite was severely outdated and you can tell little, if any, investments have been made to update the hotel. The parking garages on the hotel property are a joke. We drove a MINI and it was hit because the space for vehicles to move in there is too small! The galleon also has ridiculous rules too, like how each room is also allowed one parking pass for their death-trap parking areas? Why? Even if you pack your family in two small cars, they will make you pay to park somewhere off the hotel property for like 30 bucks a day! Absolutely ridiculous. We won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE GALLEON IS AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: catwee96
Reviews.Content: I must say, the Galleon has been my second home since I could even walk. Its a great place to relax and spend fun in the sun! I just love it, I go here every year and stay in the Galleon. It just makes life such a breeze. I think everyone should stay at the Galleon.

Reviews.Title: “Galleon perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mrsrwk
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Galleon. The tiki bar by the pool - what a great bar!! Great drinks, music and bartenders. The view is beautiful. It's worth looking for when you're in the mood to just sit and talk to other vacationers or to bartender Steve - great guy!

Reviews.Title: “Chillin' out in the sun”
Reviews.Author: Ludgates
Reviews.Content: I rented an apartment overlooking the marina for a week at the Galleon with my wife and 4 month old baby in February. We found the staff all to be very helpful and we pleased to see a travel cot in our apartment on arrival as requested. The rooms are spacious with a great large balcony off both the main bedroom and lounge. The decor is fine but is a little dated. It was really handy to have a kitchen and laundry facilities within the apartment. Free internet was a bonus although frustrating slow at times. The heated pool is great or you can sit out on the loungers on the dock. There was a dockside bar which seemed to have really good live music in the evenings which was great but could do with doing coffees, fruit juices/smoothies and snacks. There's a small sandy beach, but when it was hot it was a nice refreshing alternative to swim in the sea rather than the pool. The location is fantastic in that its quiet but only a couple of blocks away from the lively end of Duval with an abundence of bars and restuarants to choose from. It wasn't inexpensive but then again Key West isn't the place to go if looking for inexpensive accomadation. It's a great place though, very chilled out and all you want after a long cold winter.

Reviews.Title: “Galleon is NOT the best Key West has to offer!!”
Reviews.Author: Bluehendude
Reviews.Content: First I must say, we had a very nice view from our room of the Gulf of Mexico and the pool is very nice. This is where the nice part of the Galleon Resort begins and ends. My wife and I come to Key West twice a year and have stayed at some of Key West's nicest hotels and timeshare units. The front desk clerks at the Galleon need to take a course in interpersonal and customer service skills--very rude and act as if your smallest request is a complete inconvenience to them. First impressions are very important and it leaves a bad taste in your mouth when your first experience with a resort is rudeness. We had broken toilet seat that needed to be fixed and the maintenance man was rude as well. He made it a point to find my wife and complain about our use of air conditioning--Key West is a tropical climate and air conditioning is needed with the heat and humidity Housekeeping--what housekeeping?? I understand at a timeshare you do not get daily housekeeping and we did not expect this as we are timeshare owners. No towels were changed during our week stay, we needed to empty our own trash, and I don't want to even speak of the condition of the bathroom-the toilet was a science project and was probably not cleaned for months. I had to laugh when housekeeping made it a point to leave an tip envelope-that really takes some nerve. My wife had to sign a release form just to get the balcony doors unlocked--I'm staying at a resort on the water, why in the world would I want to be able to see the water or sit on the balcony?? I had to go to the front desk three times and sign a form just to get the balcony doors unlocked. In the guest directory it states as part of the check out procedure you have strip the linens from the beds and on top of it you could be responsible for an excessive room cleaning charge. The Galleon is not the best Key west has to offer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- RUDE front desk”
Reviews.Author: offy01
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in the two bedroom suite with a couple of buddies. This resort only allows 1 vehicle per room. We asked the front desk for permission to park an additional vehicle overnight and they were extremely rude and denied our request. I would understand if the lot was completely full, but there was numerous spots throughout the lot. So much for customer service. The location is the best in Key West and the pool is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - excellent location and facilities”
Reviews.Author: dogwalkerNorfolk
Reviews.Content: The Galleon exceeded all expectations. The location was unbelievable - right at the Key West Seaport, steps from the shopping district and Mallory Square. The unit was spacious and beautifully appointed. We had exquisite sunrises over our balcony, and the widow's walk on the roof of the resort offers the best sunset viewing on the island. Private pool, beach, tiki bar, restaurant - all top notch. We've gone to RCI resorts for 20 years, and we think this was the best one. Don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Location and good times”
Reviews.Author: Cancerman76
Reviews.Content: My parents have hade a time share here for about ten years now... They own multiple weeks and we go every year... The Galleon is in a great location... A couple blosk off Duval, on Front Street. Grab a to go cup, mix yourself a stiff drink or beer and begin... You can walk to everything from the location... Duval is like two minutes away and we typically start at Front and start our bar crawl... Rooms are good size, but very dated... Most units have a full kitchen... Pool is a good time as long as you don't go during a break when kids will be there visiting their grandparents... Pool bar mixes some tastey drinks, but not as good as stiff as the one you can make in your room and bring down... Or just bring a small cooler with some beers... Private beach its anything special... We never use it... The Galleon is a time share hotel, so if your are paying to stay... Go someplace else, unless you are paying a friend or family... As you can see from some of the other reviews, if you don't like your room... Too bad... It's not the Hyatt!!! If you are trading a week, you should be good to go!! Just do your reseach and find out the location of the room... You could be faceing the pool or the harbor (which is a great view). There also a building neer the street... Avoid that building at all cost... Not a nice...

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin346
Reviews.Content: If you are bringing your own boat to Key West, the Galleon is a great place to stay. You can launch the boat at the city marina, park your truck and never drive during your entire vacation. There are plenty of restaurants and watering holes within walking distance, and the fish cleaning table is a great place to hang out in the evening. You can even feed a Tarpon by hand. Sand Key is close by for snorkeling and there are boats to take you parasailing right on the boardwalk. The two-bedroom units are nice and spacious with lots of room to stow your gear away. The kitchens are fairly well equipped, but who really wants to do a lot of cooking. The elevator is slow and hot; we called it the "Hellevator" but it is welcome when hauling rods and dive gear to the upper floors. We stayed at the Galleon every Sportsman Week from 2005 to 2008. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation”
Reviews.Author: allison4908
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews as I always do, everything from the best to the worst, I really didn't know what to expect. We have traveled extensively and thought this was one of the nicest places we have ever stayed. We stayed in the F building in a room with a lock out. The main condo was decorated very nicely, everything appeared new and clean, and the kitchen had everything we needed. The lock out was smaller, but just as nice; plenty of room, including a newer-looking tiny kitchen area with a fridge, microwave and coffee pot. The location of the Galleon cannot be beat; we could walk to Duval Street, Mallory Square, etc. The resort offered a very inexpensive lunch twice during the week, poolside, which was very good for the price. Although the beach is very small; you must realize that most resorts on Key West have no beach/ocean access. It was great for just laying in floaties trying to stay cool. The only negative thing about the pool area was the temperature of the pool itself; it felt more like a hot tub, but it was July in Key West!!! I would recommend and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good efficiency suite”
Reviews.Author: hcole3
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Galleon efficiency suite building room G21. June 29-July 3, 2009 Nice efficiency right on Front street looking directly at the A&B Lobster house sign. Room cleaners never did leave three bath towels for us even after we requested this at desk. parking was a problem with a midsize car dodge avenger. got lucky that we found a parking spot a couple times. Two seperate occasions passenegers had to get out of veheicle and help driver to back into tight parking space. No ice machine on premises. Costs $2 in quarters to wash clothes. another $2 dollars to dry clothes. Pool walkway was being rebuilt with new wood decking while we were there. Rooftop observation deck was open on western part of hotel above front desk part of building. eastern observation near front street was closed. elevator in building F was out of order. have to pay to get on internet $5 minimum usage. tiki bar was open. Plenty of restaurants within short walking distnace to eat at. Can rent bycycles and scooters and electric cars right bellow efficiency. very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “The Galleon Rocks!!!!”
Reviews.Author: RelaxEnjoyLife
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with our best friends. We were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversaries!!! We had HIGH expectations of course. The place well over exceeded our expectations! We had a two bedroom suite that overlooked the pool and marina. What an amazing view. What a huge unit also!!! The beds were very comfortable and the location was perfect! Go next door to A & B restaraunt for a very excellent meal. We went for our anniversaries so we were prepared to drop $$$! Good Food, Great Service. Key West was very amazing. Rent Bikes and go to different beaches. Go to Mallory Square at night. Do the snorkling tour with Sebago! They were so fun!!! I can't say enough about the Galleon though. We were very impressed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This was a GREAT place..”
Reviews.Author: runabout333
Reviews.Content: We have rented a time share for 2 consecutive years at the Galleon and loved it.. Everything was perfect.. Right down town,,,, great private fishing pier,, fantastic sun-bathing deck for the wife that was gigantic.. We only had a lock-out but it was always cleaned and the linens always changed and all of the help at the Galleon were very nice and friendly.. If you haven't stayed at the Galleon in Key West,,, you owe it to yourself..

Reviews.Title: “Loud, Only Average Service and Cleanliness, and Very Tiny Private Beach”
Reviews.Author: akd22
Reviews.Content: The walls are thin, and there is a lot of noise at night. The noise comes from other rooms where drunk people reside as well as from the Harbor Walk (boardwalk), which is close to the hotel where drunk people walk around at night. It was hard to sleep as a result. In particular, if you plan to sleep past 7 a.m., forget about it. Other residents, especially those with children, will make sure you are up bright and early every morning. I was very disappointed with the resort's "private beach." Yes, they have one--if you consider a twenty foot by 20 foot swath of sand to be a private beach. In addition, the area of water you can then swim in is also very small. It is sectioned off about 50 feet from shore. I would guesstimate you can swim in the ocean for about a total of 100 square feet. It is very shallow in this area, however, so you can't really swim. I should have more properly said you can WADE in the ocean for about a total of 100 feet. Plus, every morning, there is a ton of seaweed washed up on the private beach. It takes maintenance about 2 hours to clean all of it. So, you can't really use the "private beach" until about 11 a.m. Then, it is populated mainly by small children who make a lot of noise. So, if you are an adult who just wants to lay out there and relax, forget about it. The rooms were of average cleanliness. I found 2 hairs while I was there (that were not my own)! This is a condominium complex, not a hotel. Therefore, maid service is very limited. All they did for us was exchange towels and put new sheets on the bed every day. They did not clean the shower or anything else. And, when they dumped out our trash, they didn't even change the bag. So, all the stickiness from the trash stayed in the bag, and by the end of our week's stay, the trash really stunk. Furthermore, they charged me for a pool towel I never used. I tried to explain that there was a mistake, but the staff was unwavering. Speaking of the pool, however, I will say that the highlight of my week at the resort was pool-side bingo (yes--that was the highlight at that resort if that tells you anything). Everyday, there is bingo that starts at 2 pm and which is played by the pool. It is $5 for five games, and you win $30 for the first 4 games and about $150 for the final black-out game. I won once all week, but it was fun. This resort has a good location insofar as it is right on the marina. It is a "good" location if you like looking at boats in the water, but not if you want to swim or snorkel. For those things, you will inevitably have to find a public beach or pay a private charter to take you out to the reef. There were other resorts that had much larger private beaches that would have allowed us to do those activities on resort property. This resort, unfortunately, did not. The resort has a concierge who will make reservations for you for any activities you want to do on the island. However, there is just one of her and many guests who want her attention. Therefore, you have to wait a long time if you want to talk to her. If you have a busy day planned and expect to be in-and-out to see her and then get on with your day, forget about it. Allocate at least half an hour for every time you want to talk to her. And, the discounts she can provide are not that substantial. Furthermore, she will pressure you to buy a time-share there. Even if you tell her you are not interested, expect to be told about it all week, every time you see her. There are lounge chairs on a private boardwalk belonging to the resort that you can relax on and look at boats in the water. Unfortunately, most of this boardwalk is right in front of their "Tiki Bar." So, you have drunk men staring at you for most of the day if you sit out there, and it is loud. The Tiki Bar's patrons tend to be over the age of 60 and, especially at night, it tends to be frequented just by men who seem like heavy drinkers. It was not an amenable place to socialize.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in paradise”
Reviews.Author: pairagators
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of our stay at the Galleon Resort. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Any minor problem was taken care of immediately. We were well advised as to what areas of the island to enjoy. Our unit was spacious, clean and fulfilled our every need. The location made our vacation even more enjoyable as we were close to all activities and restaurants and able to enjoy a beautiful sunset from our rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “The best time of my life”
Reviews.Author: forestsinkum
Reviews.Content: Myself and family came to Key West Florida for the first time this month. We stayed at the galleon. Excellent staffing, the people who worked here were so friendly. We spent one day on the jet ski's and took a rental boat out for a day. We have never been on such nice boats before. Make sure to talk to Keith or Alesh they are the best. Happy Travels James Stuart

Reviews.Title: “Can't comment on the hotal but Galleon Boat Rentals at the Resort Marina - what an idiot!”
Reviews.Author: jumpchick
Reviews.Content: I treated my sister, my neice and her two friends to a week in Key West for their last spring break from college. I wanted to rent a small boat to run out to the reef and snorkel and then head to the sandbar and relax and have a cocktail. The winds were blowing hard at 20 to 25 on Sunday and were scheduled to lay down a bit on Tuesday. My sister and I were referred to Galleon boat rentals and visited their kiosk at the marina at Galleon Resort. I explained that I had my own 21 ft boat and I had been a Coast Guard captain for over 15 years and I was concerned about taking their 22 foot rental out in these winds; however, if the winds laid down I would be interest in renting the boat on Tuesday. Keith, the person at the Kiosk, agreed that being safe was the best course of action and he joked that keeping his customers safe increased repeat business. Tuesday morning that winds were already at 20 by the time the marina opened. We showed up 10 minutes after they opened and advised them we would not be renting the boat due to the winds. Keith, the person in charge, agreed the winds were too high and we agreed to shoot for Wednesday. Wednesday morning came and the winds were again at 20 by 9:00am and forecasted to increase to 30. No one in their right mind would take a 22 ft boat out in 30MPH winds. When we called to explain we would not be taking the boat for the day on Wednesday due to the winds, Keith immediately began yelling at me saying he had "reserved" the boat for two days and we were obligated to take it. "reserverd" is hysterical because there was not one other reservation for the entire day for ANY of his boats for Tuesday or Wednesday. Additionally, why did he agree that 20mph was too much on Tuesday but suddenly 30mph was fine on Wednesday? I think he just got up on the wrong side of the bed, or perhaps he works on commission and realized that the winds were ruining his check for the month. I have no idea what prompted his outburst but it was completely unprofessional and innappropriate. My main concern is that he would send some unsuspecting tourist out in his rental boats in high winds just to make a buck with NO concern for their safety. Fortunately I knew better but what about those northerners who take their lake boats out once a year and think they can handle Key West sand bars and breakers in 30MPH winds?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but poor service.”
Reviews.Author: scoop312
Reviews.Content: We had one of the penthouse suites. The issue with the Galleon Resort was that the front desk staff were very rude and unhelpfull with just about every request. We had three couples staying in a 3 bedroom suite, and they only allowed a parking pass for 1 vehicle. The pool area and bar were excellent. Very rude front desk staff was our major complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but Close to Everything in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Other14620
Reviews.Content: No Car Needed; we can walk to every attraction in Key West. Water sports on site. 3 blocks to Mallory Square for sunset celebration or roof top observation deck afforts a great view of sunset, Sunset Key, and all of Key West. Two blocks to Duval and all the craziness of Key West, but the place is quiet and as secluded as any place in Key West. Great Hot Tub and Fitness room. Pool is relaxing temperature to float all afternoon. Tables with umbrellas make it great to read a book by the pool. Tiki bar and dock side cafe offer Tapas as well as lunch type food. Definate A++ for Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ftdmhap
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for two weeks over the Christmas holidays and loved it. The location is outstanding and the staff was extremely helpful and curteous. We traded in from RCI for a two bedroom suite. Large, clean, and comfortable; with meals on the balcony overlooking the water making the vacation. After reading two of the negative reviews we were hesitant, but friends raved about this place so we tried it. The entire resort was spotless. Would definitely recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: Guytraveler
Reviews.Content: I was a bit leary to stay here after reading some reviews but had heard from friends of friends who live in Key West that this was the place to stay. There were 4 of us adults traveling and had a 2br unit booked. The check in process was a little longer than expected but we were happy to be in Key West so we didn't care. The gentleman who checked us in was very gracious and helpful about things to do on the island. There was a concierge on property but we never got a chance to meet with her. Upon entering the unit, we were ecstatic to find that everything was more than we had anticipated. It was like having your own home as it had a full size kitchen which helped save some money for nights out on the town drinking. Our unit faced the marina which was nice as we spent a couple of evenings eating out on the balcony watching the boats come in. Everyone that we talked to around the pool seemed happy about being there. The location can't be beat! Not sure where these bad reviews came from as the room was clean and everyone was pleasant and its close to the main street of Key West where all the action happens. We'll be back in a few weeks to attend a wedding and look forward to our trip back! The only bad part of the trip was having to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I have every Stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rrice215
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Galleon on December 9th - 13th. Our wedding was on the 13th and I contacted the Galleon in June to see if we could book the observation deck for our ceremony, the assistant mangager told me he would put through my request and get back to me with an answer and pricing. He never called me back I called to check the status 6 times no one would talk to me about it and kept putting me into vociemail. I also called to see if we could up grad our room to a room with a balcony. When I go the call to upgrade I could understand what the customer service person was saying because his english was so bad so I just said yes I want the room thinking that they knew I wanted a balcony room. I called back later to confirm that it was a balcony room and they said yes. When I arrived we had a room with no balcony and a window facing the elevator wall. I called they told me that I made the mistake and still charged me for the "upgrade". Needless to say it was completely disappointing stay especially for a my wedding. My family and I will NEVER stay again with such rude people and horrible service.

Reviews.Title: “count the days 'til we return every year!”
Reviews.Author: aimeezing
Reviews.Content: my family has been going to the galleon for over twenty years. my parents, my sister and my aunt all are owners at the galleon. we decided to buy last year. we take three to five vacations every year- from venezuela, costa rica, mexico, europe, canada, caribbean and we look forward to key west from the moment we leave until the next year, counting down the days. almost without fail, the staff at the galleon is cordial, helpful and efficient. if there is something that we would like to use that is not in the room- a lobster pot, toaster oven, etc.- they promptly deliver it. we always get the seats we want on the beach. the pool is refreshing and clean and the pool staff is great. they treat their owners very well. i highly recommentd the galleon and the location cannot be beat! if you are looking to party hearty and continue on at the galleon, i would suggest a different place. the galleon is quiet and peaceful, family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: David-on-the-Road
Reviews.Content: The room had an outstanding view of the marina and was perfectly located to both the marina and the action on Duval - not too close, not too far - just right! The rooms are large and comfortable. A sure thing!

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear of the Galleon Key West!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lambchopp
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort is unsanitary at the least. Dark dingy. We could not even stay even though we lost our money. Dirt and grunge was so thick it was disgusting. The units are time shares and rented out only to make money. They are not taken care of at all. The cabinets were cracked and coming off the wall. Black stuff ran from the cracks in the shower when the water was running. To make matters worse we found out after returning home that the pictures of the room on the web were photoshopped obviously to make it look more spacious. DO NOT STAY HERE NO MATTER WHAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Return!!!”
Reviews.Author: changesinlatitudesNJ
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in a one bedroom unit timeshare booked through RCi in the past and had no issues. We then booked a "hotel unit" for another stay in July. It could not hold a candle to the first unit. Small is an understatement, dark and outdated. However, it was fairly clean, and the location was excellent. We decided to book again for a trip in August. We booked another "hotel room" through RCI. Early in the week, the appliances in surrounding units were being removed and placed in the hallways. On Tuesday of our stay, tile work began...and the noise that accompanies such work. When we walked out of our room, the tile saw was against the door of our unit. Saws, bags of concrete, and other misc. construction supplies filled the hallway between our room and the stairwell. On Wednesday, we awoke at 8 am to the same construction noise. I tripped over leering workers as I left the room. Management was not willing to move us. Finally, they said they would move us two floors lower, however, the gentleman behind me was on that floor, and he was not only dealing with the noise but an infestation of ants. Upon returning to the room after the disappointing and aggravating conversation, we found the tile workers in our room!!!! They breached the door between the two units to work on the lip between the door!!! That was the final straw. We once again asked to be moved and were told we couldn't be because the resort would have to reimburse the owners of other units. We were told if we didn't like it, we could leave. (What happened to good ol' customer service??) So we did. We called a cab, packed our bags, and ended up at the Southernmost on Duval St. It was fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Take Your Kids”
Reviews.Author: MiamiJudge
Reviews.Content: We had the worst vacation in this hotel. The people in the room next to ours were drunk and loud the whole time. When we complained to the management, we were told that those people are paying customers too and if we didnt like it there to go elsewhere. This place is unreal. We will be more careful in the future avoid these low life hotels when traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Marina”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNemo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the marina. Nice, showers were good. Ice, and marina store could have been better. Dock masters were great. Maybe just make sure there is ice for sale in the ice chests. At least in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “The Galleon sucked !!”
Reviews.Author: PghBob
Reviews.Content: The room in the G building was filthy. There was mold in the bathroom.The rug was dirty. I had to call for maintenance twice to come and kill the ants. The final crowning glory was the fact that I ended up with about a dozen bed-bug bites. Out of the six days of my stay the maid service (?) came only three times. The explanation - if they come once and you are in the room they don't come back! The pool area was OK, but the 'hot' tub/spa jacuzzi or whatever it is called was never hot because the heater didn't work, and fixing it didn't seem to be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Galleon is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleMaryland
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Key West. You can walk to everything. The folks that talk about the G Building - well that is the economy building- CHECK WHAT YOU ARE GETTING. There are other building such as C, B, A and F that have tremenous units and views. The average price for a unit for night hovers around $500. If you are not paying that much, I would find out what you are getting. If you pay bargain basement, you are going to get the G Building. The Galleon was wonderful facilities. A great pool, hot tub and a small beach built on the Gulf Waters. What a treat to get away and enjoy yourselves. We have stayed at the Galleon for the past 10 years and would never stay anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “We agree that the G building is HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: travellingatty
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in G-23 with no other rooms available during the boat show weekend and it absolutely ruined our trip. The floors were so dirty they turned my feet black, the room smelled like mold or must, the noise of the scooter rental below our room was ridiculous, as was the sound of the person in the unit above us. The shower was almost too small to use and the water pressure was ridiculous. On the last day, there were even ants in the room. The beach is very small and was in the shade after 2pm. The bar service was very slow and they don't let you charge to the room so you have to bring cash or a credit card while you are swimming and sunning! Worst of all, the service was horrible. They told us it was a wonderful room before we made the reservations and when I asked if there were any bad things about the room, they never told us it overlooked the scooter shop or the garbage bin, nor did they tell us about the super-small bathroom. On the last day of the trip, a friend dropped off a little present for me at the front desk. They never told me about the package and let me check out without giving it to me. What's worse, when my friend contacted me the next day and I told them what happened, they told the friend they had no record of my staying there, nor did they have the package! They ruined my trip to Key West!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Galleon”
Reviews.Author: gt_linz
Reviews.Content: We exchanged into the Galleon thru RCI and stayed in a 2 BR suite with another couple. They put us in the "worst view" 2 br suite (garden view 2nd floor) but it still had a nice view of the ocean from our patio. Here are THE PROS: the location was unbeatable. We were a few blocks from Mallory Square (see the Cat Man show!) and had water on 2 sides of the property. The Galleon has a marina which is part of a larger marina with restaurants, cruises, and fishing excursions right at our fingertips. The grounds are also well maintained with lots of decking and lounge chairs along the water. There was tiki bar, an adequate pool, and a rooftop platform for viewing amazing sunsets that was awesome. THE CONS: the unit was built on the 70s. Many updates had been done but the whirlpool tub was clean but in bad shape. The furniture was nice and clean and the unit was clean when we got there except the floors were dirty (walking barefoot got your feet black). The staff is not overly helpful and they have a lot of rules that are in place because a few people ruined it for the rest of us. And the workout room was horrible - broken equipment and a strong smell of mold. Overall - if you want a nice clean place to stay in a perfect location, go to the Galleon and have the time of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: FlashOhio
Reviews.Content: The Galleon is a gem! We stayed there before and will definately come back. The location is great. The pool and tiki bar is the best. You can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort but dissapointed how problem was addressed”
Reviews.Author: ABSKi
Reviews.Content: We loved the resort with the small beach, pool, marina, and bar. There could be some small updates with the units, but overall we were pleased. The big problem was the night before we left. We came in around 11:30 and the airconditioner was not working, and by this time there wasn't anyone at the front desk. I called security which was listed for emergency. He basically told me that no one would come that late to fix the airconditioner. It was 80 degrees in the room and climbing. It was miserable. We didn't sleep, and my 3 year old coughed all night because he was so hot. I kept calling and finally somerone came an hour before check out time the next morning, and looked at it and left. We were sweating trying to pack our bags, and then they had the nerve to call and rudely tell us that it was ten minutes after ten and we needed to get out. This was the final straw. It is a nice palce to stay with a great location, but beware if you have an issue or problem; don't expect it to be addressed in a timely manner.

HotelInfo.Name: Galleon Resort And Marina
HotelInfo.Address: 617 Front Street, Key West, FL 33040
